commit_message:
Fix tls-proxy on newer versions of openssl

Newer versions of openssl (CentOS9Stream for example) do not like using sha1.
Devstack will fail on these systems[1] with the following error:
801B93DCE77F0000:error:03000098:digital envelope routines:do_sigver_init:invalid digest:crypto/evp/m_sigver.c:333:
This patch updates the tls-proxy code in devstack to use sha256 instead of sha1 which allows devstack to complete when tls-proxy is enabled.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/1d90b22a39c74e24a8390861b3c5f957/log/job-output.txt#5535

Closes-Bug: #1962600

Change-Id: I71e1371affe32f070167037b0109a489d196bd31
(cherry picked from commit 35bc600da17c7342345fa9c4d0b8078a8388fad1)

commit_message:
Fix net_cidr_map in environments/deployed-network-environment.j2.yaml

With multiple subnets per network the net_cidr_map right now looks like:
    net_cidr_map:
      external:
      - 10.0.0.0/24
      internal_api:
      - 172.17.0.0/24
      internal_api:
      - 172.17.1.0/24
      internal_api:
      - 172.17.2.0/24
      storage:
      - 172.18.0.0/24
      storage:
      - 172.18.1.0/24
      storage:
      - 172.18.2.0/24
      ...

While it should be:
    net_cidr_map:
      external:
      - 10.0.0.0/24
      internal_api:
      - 172.17.0.0/24
      - 172.17.1.0/24
      - 172.17.2.0/24
      storage:
      - 172.18.0.0/24
      - 172.18.1.0/24
      - 172.18.2.0/24
      ...

Change-Id: I365e0e41ed78c79175d97f11c3a6fd69460bae5f
(cherry picked from commit 602de1af0b4fe230469a28b35f8f429a464563d8)

commit_message:
[nova/libvirt] Support for checking and enabling SMM when needed

Check the features list we get from the firmware descriptor file
to see if we need SMM (requires-smm), if so then enable it as
we aren't using the libvirt built in mechanism to enable it
when grabbing the right firmware.

Closes-Bug: 1958636

Change-Id: I890b3021a29fa546d9e36b21b1111e8537cd0020
Signed-off-by: Imran Hussain <ih@imranh.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit 6ad789010043dc4dcf8d1c0f497b6c728d230f45)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/849676/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_guest_config_with_secure_boot_and_smm_required(self): drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) # uefi only used with secure boot drvr._host._supports_uefi = True # smm only used with secure boot drvr._host._supports_secure_boot = True # NOTE(imranh2): Current way of gathering firmwares is inflexible # nova/tests/fixtures/libvirt.py FakeLoaders has requires-smm # defined. do the following to make sure we get this programtically # in the future we should test firmwares that both do and don't # require smm but the current way firmware is selected doesn't # make it possible to do so. loader, nvram_template, requires_smm = drvr._host.get_loader( 'x86_64', 'q35', True) image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict({ 'disk_format': 'raw', # secure boot requires UEFI 'properties': { 'hw_firmware_type': 'uefi', 'hw_machine_type': 'q35', 'os_secure_boot': 'required', }, }) instance_ref = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) disk_info = blockinfo.get_disk_info( CONF.libvirt.virt_type, instance_ref, image_meta) cfg = drvr._get_guest_config( instance_ref, [], image_meta, disk_info) # if we require it make sure it's there if requires_smm: self.assertTrue(any(isinstance(feature, vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestFeatureSMM) for feature in cfg.features))

commit_message:
Remove double mocking... again

I thought we fixed all the double mocking issues with
I3998d0d49583806ac1c3ae64f1b1fe343cefd20d but I was wrong.

While we used both mock and unittest.mock the fixtures.MockPatch
used the mock lib instead of the unittest.mock lib.
The path Ibf4f36136f2c65adad64f75d665c00cf2de4b400 (Remove the PowerVM driver)
removed the last user of mock lib from nova. So it is also
removed the mock from test-requirements. This triggered that
fixtures.MockPatch athat started using unittest.mock too.

Before Ibf4f36136f2c65adad64f75d665c00cf2de4b400 a function can be mocked
twice once with unittest.mock and once with fixtures.MockPatch (still
using mock). However after that patch both path of such double
mocking goes through unittest.mock and the second one fails.

So this patch fixes double mocking so far hidden behind
fixtures.MockPatch.

Also this patch makes the py310 and functional-py310 jobs voting at
least in the check queue to prevent future changes adding double mocks.

Change-Id: Ic1352ec31996577a5d0ad18a057339df3e49de25

commit_message:
keystone: Remove redundant 'run_once'

In a multi-controller node, the presence of "run_once: True"
and "when: inventory_hostname == groups['keystone'][-1]"
will cause the task to be skipped

Change-Id: I4fc2a34d89bf311f074c3c07f75dd992aac2ba6c

commit_message:
[CI] Test ProxySQL with shards in the nova cells scenario

There are two shards:
One 2-node (to test the clustering), one 1-node.

Change-Id: If3a60ad4cc39d6ad0cd72a934f5f7497cd44021b
Co-Authored-By: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/21/770621/77 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enable_proxysql: "yes"

subject: Add proxysql-config role and wrap it in loadbalancer-config role

commit_message:
Add proxysql-config role and wrap it in loadbalancer-config role

This patch ads proxysql-config role
which is used for generating users and
rules configuration.

Change-Id: I1fcb0e8040ea55f8f6b8384a56479eabdaf61c33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/42/851442/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: project_name: "proxysql-config" proxysql_project_database_shard: "{{ lookup('vars', (kolla_role_name | default(project_name)) + '_database_shard', default='unavailable') }}"

commit_message:
Add loadbalancer-config role and wrap haproxy-config role inside

This patch adds loadbalancer-config role
which is "wrapper" around haproxy-config
and proxysql-config role which will be added
in follow-up patches.

Change-Id: I64d41507317081e1860a94b9481a85c8d400797d

commit_message:
[WIP]Database sync between TackerDB and Kubernetes

The patch supports synchronization of Pod information
(Number of Pods, Pod name) between TackerDB and Kubernetes.
If there are differences in the Pod information,
it will synchronize the TackerDB information with the
Kubernetes information.
This process is performed periodically.

Implements: blueprint database-synchronization
Change-Id: Ifdd386d9d526153b4bdbea3ebecd613c191fea54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/30/852730/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def database_synchronization(self, context): filters = {'model': 'VnfInstance', 'field': 'instantiation_state', 'value': 'INSTANTIATED', 'op': '==' } vnf_instance_list = objects.VnfInstanceList.get_by_filters( context, filters) for vnf_instance in vnf_instance_list: vim_info = vnflcm_utils.get_vim( context, vnf_instance.vim_connection_info) vim_connection_info = (objects.VimConnectionInfo. obj_from_primitive(vim_info, context)) try: # Database synchronization works only when the # vimType is Kubernetes. if vim_connection_info.vim_type == 'kubernetes': self._vnf_manager.invoke( vim_connection_info.vim_type, 'database_synchronization', context=context, vnf_instance=vnf_instance, vim_info=vim_connection_info ) except Exception as e: LOG.error(f"Error is occoured vnf {vnf_instance.id} " f"Error: {encodeutils.exception_to_unicode(e)}")

subject: Do not send compression as acceptable encoding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-20 17:08:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/c83f9a553f4568a50ff607cc4c4f45e2f34e8e37', 'message': 'Do not send compression as acceptable encoding

When a BMC can compress a response, the internal server... or any
intermediate proxy may change a "Strong" ETag to a "Weak" ETag, as
the strength of the ETag represents the byte-by-byte consistency of the
response body.

Compressed responses may differ slightly, espesically if different encoding
is used or negotiated. This is problematic when a resource expects a
follow-up request or action to contain a "Strong" ETag as it is the client
certifying it understood the prior precise state.

We no longer request opporunistic response encoding, which should have
a minimal impact to use and provide a higher level of BMC interaction
consistency.

Change-Id: Idb2d6bee96bd23cfc4fb8f014661231766998781
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-21 00:30:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/4e2a3ac71a0748afececea1bae3682c541f1bf98', 'message': 'Do not send compression as acceptable encoding

commit_message:
Do not send compression as acceptable encoding

When a BMC can compress a response, the internal server... or any
intermediate proxy may change a "Strong" ETag to a "Weak" ETag, as
the strength of the ETag represents the byte-by-byte consistency of the
response body.

Compressed responses may differ slightly, especially if different encoding
is used or negotiated. This is problematic when a resource expects a
follow-up request or action to contain a "Strong" ETag as it is the client
certifying it understood the prior precise state.

We no longer request opportunistic response encoding, and expressly request
responses are not modified or compressed by the intermediate server, which
should have a minimal impact to use and provide a higher level of BMC
interaction consistency.

Change-Id: Idb2d6bee96bd23cfc4fb8f014661231766998781
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/47/850547/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(TheJulia): Depending on the BMC, offering compression as an # acceptable response changes the ETag behavior to offering an # automatic "weak" ETag response, which is appropriate because the # body content *may* not be a byte for byte match given compression. # Overall, the value of compression is less than the value of concise # interaction with the BMC. self._session.headers.pop('Accept-Encoding', None)

commit_message:
Add support for passing OS_CACERT

openstack deployed on IBM cloud's clouds.yaml
have cacert. While booting bmc node, it looks for
cacert file and it doesnot exists.

This changes adds the support of passing cacert file
and add it during booting.

Closes-Bug: #1983313

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I55689a42583ef0a3488c75d411ad282a97ad572b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal refs/changes/62/851862/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Write cacert file cat <<EOF >/tmp/cert $os_cacert EOF import os import shutilif "cacert" in data.keys(): file_name = str(data["cacert"]) if os.path.exists("/tmp/cert"): shutil.copy("/tmp/cert", file_name) os.system("update-ca-trust")

commit_message:
Add support for passing OS_CACERT

openstack deployed on IBM cloud's clouds.yaml
have cacert. While booting bmc node, it looks for
cacert file and it doesnot exists.

This changes adds the support of passing cacert file content
and add it during clouds.yaml specified location.

Closes-Bug: #1983313
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8372e6cfa52c2202c3241e5ea86c7ce59c1b5611
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal refs/changes/95/851795/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import osif data.has_key('cacert'): os.environ['CLOUD_CACERT'] = data['cacert']# If $os_cacert is defined then create the cacert file if [ -f "$os_cacert" ]; then mkdir -p /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors; cat <<EOF /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/$CLOUD_CACERT.crt $os_cacert EOF; update-ca-trust; fi

commit_message:
Support CentOS Stream 9

This patch includes changes required to run devstack on CentOS Stream 9
which has been already published in official repos by CentOS team [1]:

- Add RDO deps repository for CS9.
- remove xinetd package from installation for swift. Note that
  rsync-daemon is installed which should work fine.
- Replace genisoimage by xorriso in CS9.
- Use /etc/os-release to identify the distro in CS9 as it doesn't
  provide lsb_release command.
- Use pip from rpm package instead of from get-pip.py as done in Fedora.
- Add non-voting job devstack-platform-centos-9-stream to the check
  pipeline.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/848364
Change-Id: Ic67cddabd5069211dc0611994b8b8360bcd61bef
(cherry picked from commit 5ea4c3c18c558ec1fa37e0dd9b28ce66c3da1130)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/82/848282/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD (41c19b Allow to skip stop of ovn services)======= SUPPORTED_DISTROS="bullseye|focal|f34|opensuse-15.2|opensuse-tumbleweed|rhel8|rhel9" >>>>>>> CHANGE (5ea4c3 Support CentOS Stream 9) if [[ $DISTRO == "rhel8" ]]; then if [[ "$TARGET_BRANCH" == "master" ]]; then # rdo-release.el8.rpm points to latest RDO release, use that for master sudo dnf -y install https://rdoproject.org/repos/rdo-release.el8.rpm else # For stable branches use corresponding release rpm rdo_release=$(echo $TARGET_BRANCH | sed "s|stable/||g") sudo dnf -y install https://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-${rdo_release}/rdo-release-${rdo_release}.el8.rpm fi elif [[ $DISTRO == "rhel9" ]]; then sudo curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos9-master/delorean-deps.repoelif [[ $DISTRO == "rhel9" ]]; then sudo dnf config-manager --set-enabled crb # rabbitmq and other packages are provided by RDO repositories. _install_rdo
deleted_lines: if [[ "$TARGET_BRANCH" == "master" ]]; then # rdo-release.el8.rpm points to latest RDO release, use that for master sudo dnf -y install https://rdoproject.org/repos/rdo-release.el8.rpm else # For stable branches use corresponding release rpm rdo_release=$(echo $TARGET_BRANCH | sed "s|stable/||g") sudo dnf -y install https://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-${rdo_release}/rdo-release-${rdo_release}.el8.rpm

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-01 16:00:21.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tls'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/89caa372884d5f0f988ba17b821df794e3d36d7e', 'message': 'Fix tls-proxy on newer versions of openssl

Newer versions of openssl (CentOS9Stream for example) do not like using sha1.
Devstack will fail on these systems[1] with the following error:
801B93DCE77F0000:error:03000098:digital envelope routines:do_sigver_init:invalid digest:crypto/evp/m_sigver.c:333:
This patch updates the tls-proxy code in devstack to use sha256 instead of sha1 which allows devstack to complete when tls-proxy is enabled.

commit_message:
Fix tls-proxy on newer versions of openssl

Newer versions of openssl (CentOS9Stream for example) do not like using sha1.
Devstack will fail on these systems[1] with the following error:
801B93DCE77F0000:error:03000098:digital envelope routines:do_sigver_init:invalid digest:crypto/evp/m_sigver.c:333:
This patch updates the tls-proxy code in devstack to use sha256 instead of sha1 which allows devstack to complete when tls-proxy is enabled.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/1d90b22a39c74e24a8390861b3c5f957/log/job-output.txt#5535

Closes-Bug: #1962600

Change-Id: I71e1371affe32f070167037b0109a489d196bd31
(cherry picked from commit 35bc600da17c7342345fa9c4d0b8078a8388fad1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/64/848364/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default_md = sha256 -sha256 \ -sha256 \

commit_message:
Fix doc for adding sudo privileges to stack user

Writing NOPASSWD directive into /etc/sudoers was throwing
permission denied errors. This commit writes the directive
to the /etc/sudoers.d/stack file instead.

Closes-Bug: #1981541

commit_message:
Clean up db residual record from dvr port

Delete the DVR port record on the node when the router is deleted from
the node. This patch fixes an issue where the DB actions have no context
writer which will actually update nothing duing the following
`delete_distributed_port_binding_if_stale`.
As well as fixing that when the dvr router was deleted from a node,
only the ml2_distributed_port_bindings were cleaned up and not the
ml2_port_binding_levels records for the dvr port.

Remove the last VM under one router in one host, the
ml2_distributed_port_bindings and ml2_port_binding_levels will remain
the record.  So if VMs under one router had spread on many hosts,
and router (router ports) still exists, even there is only one VM under it,
the binding entries will still be equal to amount of hosts where this
router resided before. The result is a large amount of redundant data
in the database, even if some nodes are no longer in the cluster,
there are still records for that node.

Closes-Bug: #1976439
Change-Id: I320ac2306e0f25ff933d8271203e192486062d61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/05/845105/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update volume_type_project bogus column

The column should be declared as Boolean.Since it's not declared
as a Boolean, then it gets the ID value when it's soft deleted.
which creates a problem of DB the deleted column values for the
volume_type_projects ends up being the same value as the id column
which increments.

Partial-Bug: #1892088
Change-Id: I040938846af46f4505bfd3ca984607a90dcb9cf0

in our jobs, since now it's enabled, adding it to skiplist to continue
to skip it.

commit_message:
Stop using (and breaking) /var/tmp for horizon temporary things

Until now, /var/tmp label was globally changed to another value than the
default, moving from tmp_t to container_file_t due to the ":z" flag in
the horizon container mount.

This patch creates a subdirectory in /var/tmp, and mounts this location
directly in horizon's /var/tmp - this allows to NOT change anything in
horizon, while preventing potential leaks from other apps using this
location. It also prevents issues with SELinux denials on that location.

The special 1777 mode allows to ensure we get the right "tmp" mode on
the directory, meaning: drwxrwxrwt.

This patch also ensures we reset the label on /var/tmp during update and
upgrade.

Change-Id: I6c239065d4c92c9afc62ff4e513e6d097a06e218
Resolves: rhbz#1947532
Closes-Bug: #1925316

commit_message:
Stop processing stackviz

The stackviz processing takes subunit and dstat data as input and
produces a report. We stopped collecting dstat information so the
stackviz report is largely empty and only contains subunit test info.
Stop producing this report as it isn't useful and will only extend job
runtimes.

Change-Id: I2e694588e2d325b4d145649cddee4f7a6b7b320c

subject: Do not validate PyPI uploaders for new packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-09 12:43:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/pythonutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/60757222751dc82c3c4ad52821c1d925a8344bbc', 'message': "Do not validate PyPI uploaders for new packages

The validate_pypi_permissions test checks that if the package exists on
PyPI, we have permissions to upload it. In order to validate that, it
first checks that the package exists by retrieving JSON information from
PyPI, and assuming that anything returned means the package exists.

However currently PyPI returns {'message': 'Not Found'} when queried for
JSON information about a non-existant package. This makes the test
assume that the package exists but we don't have permissions to upload
it, therefore failing the test.

This fix makes sure an empty dict is returned when an inexistant package
is queried, which makes the test succeed with the following message:

'no %s project data on pypi, assuming it will be created by release'

Change-Id: I27eb82109ab93fe33c339f82ec519feeb7228a1f
"}]
commit_message:
Do not validate PyPI uploaders for new packages

The validate_pypi_permissions test checks that if the package exists on
PyPI, we have permissions to upload it. In order to validate that, it
first checks that the package exists by retrieving JSON information from
PyPI, and assuming that anything returned means the package exists.

However currently PyPI returns {'message': 'Not Found'} when queried for
JSON information about a non-existant package. This makes the test
assume that the package exists but we don't have permissions to upload
it, therefore failing the test.

This fix makes sure an empty dict is returned when an inexistant package
is queried, which makes the test succeed with the following message:

'no %s project data on pypi, assuming it will be created by release'

Change-Id: I27eb82109ab93fe33c339f82ec519feeb7228a1f

subject: Enable add_ips_to_server() and _needs_floating_ip() for pristine server resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-03 09:53:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/0a07cce6d4a44a2701d4694d1112f815778bdc6a', 'message': "Enable add_ips_to_server() and _needs_floating_ip() for pristine server resources

Previously, both functions [1] and [2] would have to be called with
server objects which have been enhanced by add_server_interfaces()
[3]. The latter adds 'public_v4' and 'private_v4' attributes to the
server objects which the default server resource [4] does not have.

Now, we check server's 'addresses' attributes for fixed and floating
ip addresses [5] in case the 'public_v4' and 'private_v4' attributes
are not available. The checks for fixed vs floating ip addresses are
equal to how find_nova_addresses() [6] distinguishes between both
ip address types.

commit_message:
Enable add_ips_to_server() and _needs_floating_ip() for pristine server resources

Previously, both functions [1] and [2] would have to be called with
server objects which have been enhanced by add_server_interfaces()
[3]. The latter adds 'public_v4' and 'private_v4' attributes to the
server objects which the default server resource [4] does not have.

Now, we check server's 'addresses' attributes for fixed and floating
ip addresses [5] in case the 'public_v4' and 'private_v4' attributes
are not available. The checks for fixed vs floating ip addresses are
equal to how find_nova_addresses() [6] distinguishes between both
ip address types.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/commit/3f81d0001dd994cde990d38f6e2671ee0694d7d5/openstack/cloud/_floating_ip.py#L979
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/commit/3f81d0001dd994cde990d38f6e2671ee0694d7d5/openstack/cloud/_floating_ip.py#L997
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/commit/3f81d0001dd994cde990d38f6e2671ee0694d7d5/openstack/cloud/meta.py#L439
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/branch/master/openstack/compute/v2/server.py
[5] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/commit/3f81d0001dd994cde990d38f6e2671ee0694d7d5/openstack/compute/v2/server.py#L81
[6] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/commit/3f81d0001dd994cde990d38f6e2671ee0694d7d5/openstack/cloud/meta.py#L69

Change-Id: I064ed922be440d911fbc492dab8465e8f75236df

Fixed 'storageResourceIds' after SCALE-OUT

This patch fixes
".instantiatedVnfInfo.vnfcResourceInfo[].storageResourceIds"
has same id as "id" shown in
".instantiatedVnfInfo.virtualStorageResourceInfo[]".

Closes-Bug: #1960194
Change-Id: I39416afd21295daf3c5d0e57c9195ac20e7e55e7

commit_message:
Add an Ansible execution environment to our Build

This change adds an ansible execution environment to our build tools,
which will allow us to run with execution environments via tripleoclient
in the future. This build simply pulls in the base ansible-runner
image, and provides an interface to download/install roles and
collections as needed.

Currently ansible-runner image is based on CS8 and tripleo-ansible
standalone work is based on CS9 master. In order to consume the
tripleo-ansible-ee image for external compute work, It needs
to be built on cs8 wallaby.

In order to avoid mixing of tripleo-ansible cs9 content,
installation of tripleo-ansible is commented out.

Change-Id: I56cabb9aa8483c5039b5920db96a00509dc730cc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Pass configured endpoint type to sahara client

Change-Id: I8136409020a7251ae1015129236b0e3d2d20a51b
Story: 2009735
Task: 44157
(cherry picked from commit 693624c9afbc3a02d24abb926baace7ea1ada6f3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/04/822804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: endpoint_type = getattr(settings, 'OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE', 'publicURL') session=sess, endpoint_type=endpoint_type)

subject: [OVN][Placement] Drive binding by placement allocation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-15 17:38:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/576c3a99f2951bd3c8eb4fcee4567470a21d3504', 'message': '[WIP][OVN][Placement] Drive binding by placement allocation

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-04-16 14:50:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/97c86b0b1a3b5bcb4188255db287ddc58aede63e', 'message': '[WIP][OVN][Placement] Drive binding by placement allocation

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2021-04-22 15:20:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/33465697b75b826e2d591b5689914db7d35d99f1', 'message': '[OVN][Placement] Drive binding by placement allocation

Add OVN to the mechanism drivers that support placement allocation.
The choice of the mecanism driver during binding process was
implemented in [1], using the "port" information provided by Nova
in "binding:profile".

The OVN mechanism driver class inherits from "MechanismDriver", that
added the API method "responsible_for_ports_allocation". [1]
implements this method for "AgentMechanismDriverBase", but OVN does
not inherit from this class, as OVS or SR-IOV mechanism drivers,
because is an agent-less mech driver.

This patch adds the specific implementation to allow the ML2 to
decide if the OVN mechanism driver is responsible for binding the
port given, based on the "port" "allocation" information and the
OVN Placement information cached from the OVN Chassis [2].

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/574783
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/776701

Partial-Bug: #1578989

Change-Id: I88376c41c9a46b2c793ad6b3ab8e0baea99b8851

commit_message:
[OVN][Placement] Drive binding by placement allocation

Add OVN to the mechanism drivers that support placement allocation.
The choice of the mechanism driver during binding process was
implemented in [1], using the "port" information provided by Nova
in "binding:profile".

The OVN mechanism driver class inherits from "MechanismDriver", that
added the API method "responsible_for_ports_allocation". [1]
implements this method for "AgentMechanismDriverBase", but OVN does
not inherit from this class, as OVS or SR-IOV mechanism drivers,
because is an agent-less mech driver.

This patch adds the specific implementation to allow the ML2 to
decide if the OVN mechanism driver is responsible for binding the
port given, based on the "port" "allocation" information and the
OVN Placement information retrieved from the SB DB Chassis
registers [2].

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/574783
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/801712

Partial-Bug: #1578989
Change-Id: I88376c41c9a46b2c793ad6b3ab8e0baea99b8851
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/78/786478/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.placement import utils as place_utils #RAH ###################################################################### # def _possible_agents_for_port(self, context): # # agent_filters = { # # 'host': [context.current['binding:host_id']], # # #'agent_type': ['OVN'], # # 'admin_state_up': [True], # # # By not filtering for 'alive' we may report being responsible # # # and still not being able to handle the binding. But that case # # # will be properly logged and handled very soon. That is when # # # trying to bind with a dead agent. # # } # # return get_agents(None, context._plugin_context, filters=agent_filters, # # _driver=self) # return [chassis for chassis in self._ovn_client._placement.chassis if # chassis.get(ovn_const.RP_BANDWIDTHS)] def responsible_for_ports_allocation(self, context): """Report if an agent is responsible for a resource provider. :param context: PortContext instance describing the port :returns: True for responsible, False for not responsible An agent based mechanism driver is reponsible for a resource provider if an agent of it is responsible for that resource provider. An agent reports responsibility by including the resource provider in the configurations field of the agent heartbeat. """ uuid_ns = self.resource_provider_uuid5_namespace if uuid_ns is None: return False if 'allocation' not in context.current['binding:profile']: return False rp = uuid.UUID(context.current['binding:profile']['allocation']) #host_agents = self._possible_agents_for_port(context) reported = {} _placement = self._ovn_client._placement_extension for ch_name, ch_rps in (_placement.chassis.items()): for device in ch_rps[ovn_const.RP_BANDWIDTHS].keys(): hostname = _placement.get_chassis_hostname(ch_name, device) device_rp_uuid = place_utils.device_resource_provider_uuid( namespace=uuid_ns, host=hostname, device=device) if device_rp_uuid == rp: reported[ch_name] = ch_rps if len(reported) == 1: LOG.debug("TODO: add something funny here...") return True elif len(reported) > 1: LOG.error("TODO: add something sad here...") return False else: # not responsible (like me), must be somebody else return False

commit_message:
Add a default table in "ip rule" command

Now it is mandatory, at least for IPv6 addresses, to define a table
when an IP rule is added. The default table selected is "default"
(table=253). In any case, all commands calling this method right now are
specifying the table in the kwargs.

Partial-Bug: #1981963
Change-Id: Ia44ac34ca9b91719a86f4d573c9777a4708d69a4

added_lines: import globalProjectStore from 'stores/keystone/project'; import { message as $message } from 'antd'; this.projectStore = globalProjectStore; this.getQuota(); this.state.isLoading = true; this.errorMsg = ''; get showQuota() { return this.props.rootStore.hasAdminOnlyRole; } async getQuota() { await this.projectStore.fetchProjectTroveQuota(this.currentProjectId); this.setState({ isLoading: false, }); } get quotaInfo() { if (this.state.isLoading) { return []; } const { instances = {}, volumes = {} } = this.projectStore.troveQuota || {}; const { left = 0 } = instances || {}; const { data: { size = 0 } = {} } = this.state; const instanceQuotaInfo = { ...instances, add: left ? 1 : 0, name: 'instance', title: t('Database Instance'), }; const { left: volumeLeft = 0 } = volumes; const volumeSizeQuotaInfo = { ...volumes, add: volumeLeft === -1 || size <= volumeLeft ? size : 0, name: 'volumeSize', title: t('Database Disk (GiB)'), type: 'line', }; this.checkQuota(this.state.data, this.projectStore.troveQuota); return [instanceQuotaInfo, volumeSizeQuotaInfo]; } getQuotaMessage(input, left, name) { if (left === -1) { return ''; } if (left === 0) { return t('Quota: Insufficient { name } quota to create resources.', { name, }); } if (input > left) { return t( 'Insufficient {name} quota to create resources(left { quota }, input { input }).', { name, quota: left, input } ); } return ''; } checkQuota(data, quota) { const { instances: { left: instanceLeft = 0 } = {}, volumes: { left: volumeLeft = 0 } = {}, } = quota || {}; const { size = 0 } = data || {}; const instanceMsg = this.getQuotaMessage( 1, instanceLeft, t('Database Instance') ); const sizeMsg = this.getQuotaMessage( size, volumeLeft, t('Database Disk (GiB)') ); if (!instanceMsg && !sizeMsg) { this.errorMsg = ''; } else { const msg = instanceMsg || sizeMsg; if (this.errorMsg !== msg) { $message.error(msg); } this.errorMsg = msg; } } get disableNext() { return !!this.errorMsg; } get disableSubmit() { return !!this.errorMsg; }

commit_message:
Adding Skyline as Emerging Technology

Skyline is new project in OpenStack and needs to do few things
in OpenStack way to be fully alligned with the OpenStack tooling
and releases:

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/814037
- https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-December/026206.html

Change-Id: I278fc5d86af865559405471771d7b2551cc740af

commit_message:
Fixed issues with __repr__ and __str__ on objects

We are currently override __repr__ in our base VersionedObject
and removing some useful information when debugging.

- Re-wrote __str__ to not raise an exception if data is missing.
- Removed some unused _to_string functions.
- Changed _from_string to from_string.

Change-Id: Idfd6c959cf943c5aaf95746f16070000bf82ca21

commit_message:
Ensure key contents are hidden

By default, the file resource shows differences when the file changes.
This change disables that for the key files so that key contents are
not displayed in output.

Closes-Bug: #1979672
Change-Id: Ic0398cfbb14782ce16710a838e5428be50f2a0b3
(cherry picked from commit c76bfbe41f7bdc37a50893609cd4d70a2a7e1a75)

commit_message:
Enhance multi tenant policy in VNF LCM

An enhancement of the multi-tenant policy in the VNF lifecycle
management.
* Discussion to enable a non-admin role user to instantiate VNF.
* Add design for negative functional test cases for VNF LCM
  operations and validate notification is received by the tenant
  specified in the subscription sequence.

Implements: bp enhance-multi-tenant-policy

Change-Id: Idf398ea9bf083afdecb99a0cea3c539a34ec17d3

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================== Enhance Multi Tenant Policy in VNF Life Cycle Management ======================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/enhance-multi-tenant-policy This specification is an enhancement for multi tenant policy in the VNF lifecycle management. It enables a non-admin role user to instantiate VNF, defines tenancy isolation between admin and the non-admin role users. Problem description =================== In tacker, a non-admin role user is able to get resource information for VNF but disallow to operate certain VNF LCM operations such as VNF instantiation. Proposed change =============== Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Manpreet Kaur <kaurmanpreet2620@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-04 10:09:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a01bd5d7ef74284f655e5c3b00651142021b07a8', 'message': 'pci: fix checking for physical function

If drivers for recently released Mellanox drivers (mlx5_core
and mlx5e_rep) are used, the VF representor is incorrectly
identified as PF. This is because the VF representor used
in switchdev mode [1] also has a value in sriov_totalvfs,
just like PF.

For example, if Mellanox Out-of-Box driver (OFED 5.4+) is
used, the values under /sys/class/net are as follows.

For PF:
  /sys/class/net/eth1/phys_port_name:p1
  /sys/class/net/eth1/device/sriov_totalvfs:10

For VF representor:
  /sys/class/net/vfrep0/phys_port_name:pf1vf0
  /sys/class/net/vfrep0/device/sriov_totalvfs:10

For VF:
  /sys/class/net/vf0/phys_port_name: Operation not supported
  /sys/class/net/vf0/device/sriov_totalvfs: No such file or directory

For reference, libvirt already contains a similar logic to determine
PF based on phys_port_name [2]. The regex to match PF is also
discussed and is used in this patch.

> All PF devices have a phys_port_name matching a particular regex
> (p[0-9]+$)|(p[0-9]+s[0-9]+$)

[1] https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/networking/switchdev.html
[2] https://gitlab.com/libvirt/libvirt/-/commit/5b1c525b1f3608156884aed0dc5e925306c1e260

Change-Id: I73b5cabdd7579b072a59ae8ab09d1efef2ec4f01
Signed-off-by: Nobuhiro MIKI <nmiki@yahoo-corp.jp>
'}]
commit_message:
pci: fix checking for physical function

If drivers for recently released Mellanox drivers (mlx5_core
and mlx5e_rep) are used, the VF representor is incorrectly
identified as PF. This is because the VF representor used
in switchdev mode [1] also has a value in sriov_totalvfs,
just like PF.

For example, if Mellanox Out-of-Box driver (OFED 5.4+) is
used, the values under /sys/class/net are as follows.

For PF:
  /sys/class/net/eth1/phys_port_name:p1
  /sys/class/net/eth1/device/sriov_totalvfs:10

For VF representor:
  /sys/class/net/vfrep0/phys_port_name:pf1vf0
  /sys/class/net/vfrep0/device/sriov_totalvfs:10

For VF:
  /sys/class/net/vf0/phys_port_name: Operation not supported
  /sys/class/net/vf0/device/sriov_totalvfs: No such file or directory

For reference, libvirt already contains a similar logic to determine
PF based on phys_port_name [2]. The regex to match PF is also
discussed and is used in this patch.

> All PF devices have a phys_port_name matching a particular regex
> (p[0-9]+$)|(p[0-9]+s[0-9]+$)

[1] https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/networking/switchdev.html
[2] https://gitlab.com/libvirt/libvirt/-/commit/5b1c525b1f3608156884aed0dc5e925306c1e260

Change-Id: I73b5cabdd7579b072a59ae8ab09d1efef2ec4f01
Signed-off-by: Nobuhiro MIKI <nmiki@yahoo-corp.jp>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/852135/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: port_name_path = "/sys/class/net/%s/%s" % (ifname, utils._PHYS_PORT_NAME) with self.patch_open(totalvf_path, '4') as mock_open_totalvf, \ self.patch_open(port_name_path, 'p1') as mock_open_port_name: mock_open_totalvf.assert_called_once_with(totalvf_path) mock_open_port_name.assert_called_once_with(port_name_path) @mock.patch('os.path.isdir', return_value=True) @mock.patch.object(os, 'readlink') def test_virtual_function_representor(self, mock_readlink, *args): ifname = 'eth0' totalvf_path = "/sys/class/net/%s/device/%s" % (ifname, utils._SRIOV_TOTALVFS) port_name_path = "/sys/class/net/%s/%s" % (ifname, utils._PHYS_PORT_NAME) mock_readlink.return_value = '../../../0000:00:00.1' with self.patch_open(totalvf_path, '4') as mock_open_totalvf, \ self.patch_open(port_name_path, 'pf1vf0') as mock_open_port_name: address, physical_function = utils.get_function_by_ifname('eth0') self.assertEqual(address, '0000:00:00.1') self.assertFalse(physical_function) mock_open_totalvf.assert_called_once_with(totalvf_path) mock_open_port_name.assert_called_once_with(port_name_path)

commit_message:
Ensure key contents are hidden

By default, the file resource shows differences when the file changes.
This change disables that for the key files so that key contents are
not displayed in output.

Closes-Bug: #1979672
Change-Id: Ic0398cfbb14782ce16710a838e5428be50f2a0b3

commit_message:
Bind mount swtpm logs in libvirt virtqemud container

Without this change, logs cannot be directly accessed on a host:

sudo podman exec -it nova_virtqemud cat /var/log/swtpm/libvirt/qemu/...

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib7edb8c2ecbc5c44a85f4040e95be22874fa2f30
(cherry picked from commit ef5d2f45a33fa6c785c3d6e876abd42d8ad953cd)

added_lines: --- features: - | Containerized Libvirt swtpm logs will be placed into `/var/log/containers/libvirt/swtpm` host path.

when it connects to iRMC via HTTPS

commit_message:
feat: support quota info when clone volume

1. Update clone volume form: add volume info, size input, type select
2. Support quota info when clone volume
3. Disable click submit button when left quota is not enough to clone
4. Update clone volume e2e

Change-Id: I3cc1d85fad75b18b88bc49a20e8feaae14d4111a

feat: support cpu && mem quota info when create instance

2. Disable click next button when cpu && mem left quota is insufficient
3. Update StepForm to support disable click next/submit button

commit_message:
project-config-grafyaml: drop job

The dependent change adds an early validation check to the
project-config-grafana change, which does the same thing as the
grafyaml test here (and then goes on to make screenshots of the
graphs, if they validate).  Remove this to aviod confusion over what
test is doing what.  Add the grafana test to the gate.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/851951
Change-Id: Ia6d6d7135c3c0517ddfe27f0389ecd32978fd120

commit_message:
grafana: explicitly validate graphs

Explicitly validate the graphs early to avoid doing anything if the
graphs won't load.

Change-Id: Ie9e858e4d8ce92e72de4358fecc40196f79b0229

commit_message:
Modify test code to avoid CONF modification affection

Few unit tests change attribute of  CONF variable via Python
assignment. This changes attribute of CONF, which is instance
of XxxOpt class defined in oslo_config, to Python literal value.

This affects result of another unit test.

To avoid this, we should change attribute of CONF variable with
set_override method.

Change-Id: I4bd8b1b4ea974834f1149fcaa79de85d24f5f7d1
Story: 2010214
Task: 45956
(cherry picked from commit 3b28d0984d5eb82320c632dd5840cebf6d0762ad)

commit_message:
Change molds option to appropriate class

At current, retry_attempt & retry_interval in ironic.conf [molds]
is instance of StrOpt. However it should be IntOpt class.
If it remains to StrOpt class, tenacity.retry wrapper in common/molds.py
will fail with TypeError.

Change-Id: Iafedf2ec0326009585c1cac251ecae65c9e666ac
Story: 2010215
Task: 45957
(cherry picked from commit 35bc014ed94ee0c78ee8d44113fcea721f0c1af0)

Assign project-scoped service role by default

... so that token validation is allowed when SRBAC is enforced in
Keystone.

commit_message:
Modify test code to avoid CONF modification affection

Few unit tests change attribute of  CONF variable via Python
assignment. This changes attribute of CONF, which is instance
of XxxOpt class defined in oslo_config, to Python literal value.

This affects result of another unit test.

To avoid this, we should change attribute of CONF variable with
set_override method.

Change-Id: I4bd8b1b4ea974834f1149fcaa79de85d24f5f7d1
Story: 2010214
Task: 45956
(cherry picked from commit 3b28d0984d5eb82320c632dd5840cebf6d0762ad)

commit_message:
Modify test code to avoid CONF modification affection

Few unit tests change attribute of  CONF variable via Python
assignment. This changes attribute of CONF, which is instance
of XxxOpt class defined in oslo_config, to Python literal value.

This affects result of another unit test.

To avoid this, we should change attribute of CONF variable with
set_override method.

Change-Id: I4bd8b1b4ea974834f1149fcaa79de85d24f5f7d1
Story: 2010214
Task: 45956
(cherry picked from commit 3b28d0984d5eb82320c632dd5840cebf6d0762ad)
(cherry picked from commit 593a547a8dbbbeee2225520812f8b235c39656b0)

commit_message:
Change molds option to appropriate class

At current, retry_attempt & retry_interval in ironic.conf [molds]
is instance of StrOpt. However it should be IntOpt class.
If it remains to StrOpt class, tenacity.retry wrapper in common/molds.py
will fail with TypeError.

Change-Id: Iafedf2ec0326009585c1cac251ecae65c9e666ac
Story: 2010215
Task: 45957
(cherry picked from commit 35bc014ed94ee0c78ee8d44113fcea721f0c1af0)

commit_message:
Change molds option to appropriate class

At current, retry_attempt & retry_interval in ironic.conf [molds]
is instance of StrOpt. However it should be IntOpt class.
If it remains to StrOpt class, tenacity.retry wrapper in common/molds.py
will fail with TypeError.

Change-Id: Iafedf2ec0326009585c1cac251ecae65c9e666ac
Story: 2010215
Task: 45957
(cherry picked from commit 35bc014ed94ee0c78ee8d44113fcea721f0c1af0)

commit_message:
Migrate to AngularJS v1.8.2

This patch aligns current code with AngularJS v1.8.2 requirements.
It also updates zun-ui to use the Firefox browser instead of phantomjs
browser to fix "nodjs-run-test" job because phantomjs browser has some
issue with backticks.

Change-Id: Ibf995d6c29f64cd902834b64664cd87ef5014a45

commit_message:
Move __str__ to the PciAddressSpec base class

PhysicalPciAddress had __str__ defined but actually since
I6e94df5dbe56c51fd4704b50a6af53aa38f8453f __str__ make sense for each
children of PciAddressSpec so it is moved there.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I87f2db5cfe46d19edd56c70c0058d637633461fb

added_lines: def __str__(self): return f'{self.domain}:{self.bus}:{self.slot}.{self.func}'

commit_message:
Fix type annotation of pci.Whitelist class

Whitelist._parse_white_list_from_config iterates its input as json
strings so the input should be a list of strings.

Change-Id: Ib23dc94b3f7a22050e6b13ae058302c6fd2d71ae

commit_message:
Remove dead code from PhysicalPciAddress

The PhysicalPciAddress was implemented to handle both dict and string
inputs but the production code only ever calls it with string. There is
good test coverage for this codepath added in
I40888b8860e8cbf0025e21750bfd7240e692ed65 but an extra case has been
added by the current patch as well.

A set of non realistic test cases has been removed as those blindly
passed dicts to PhysicalPciAddress

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement

Change-Id: I59a87e8d1164a709f5cd0208aea71d130d71d6e9

commit_message:
add configurable per port bridges

This patch add a new configuration option to use
per port bridge when hybrid_plug is false.
This can be used with OVN to reduce packet loss
during a live migration.

OVN can only install openflow rules when a port both has
external_ids set and an ofport-id assigned.
Since the ofport-id is only assigned when a netdev matching
the port name exists connected to the dataplane, OVN cannot
install the flows until libvirt create the tap on the destination
host during a live migration.

On loaded systems this can result in multiple seconds of packet loss.
To address this we introduce per port bridges which are connencted
to the integration brige by a patch port pair. Since the patch port
will exist on the dataplane during pre live migration OVN can install
the flows on the integration bridge before we begin the migration reducing
or avoiding packet loss.

Change-Id: I0d55ccbef5b585330b5512e67e442b80304a2e73
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/790447
Closes-Bug: #1933517
(cherry picked from commit b837c1a74f37191692a820711e431a75516a4abf)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/75/802475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The os-vif OVS plugin now supports using per-port OVS bridges when hybrid plug is not used. This is disabled by default and can be enabled by defining ``[os_vif_ovs]/per_port_bridge=True`` in the compute service nova.conf. This capability should only be enabled if you are deploying with ml2/ovn and experience packet loss during live migrations. This is not supported on windows or when using ironic smartnic ports. This option was introduced to address bug: #1933517. When using OVN as a network backend OVN requires the OVS interface to both have an ofport-id and the neutron port uuid defined in the external_ids field. When the port is plugged if ``[os_vif_ovs]/per_port_bridge`` is not enabled then the OVS port will not be assigned an openflow port id until the tap device is created on the host. On loaded system with many flows and ports it can take a few second for OVN to detect the creation of the tap device and install the correct flows. During that interval packets can be dropped. When ``[os_vif_ovs]/per_port_bridge`` is enabled, os-vif will add the VM tap device to a new bridge that is connected to the integration bridge via a patch port. This enables OVN to install the openflow rules on the integration bridge before the tap is created reducing the possibility for packet loss during a live migration. By default per port bridges are disabled and this feature is considered experimental, however it will likely be enabled by default in the future after we gain experience with how this bridge topology scales in larger deployments.

commit_message:
Clean up mapping input to address spec types

The goal here is to make it clear which PciAddressSpec child class
parses which form of input. But along the way the devname handling is
also simplified as there is no need to look up the PF capability of the
devname just to parse the address of it. This way the duplicated PF
capability lookup can be removed from the code.

Fortunately this also answered one of my earlier question about PF
capability lookup (see the removed question from the test code).
Also this automatically fixed the bug where some of the pci utils
functions called with repr strings of PciAddressGlobSpec objects instead
of a real PCI address.

A follow up will clean up a now unused PF capability part of the
get_function_by_ifname function.

Closes-Bug: #1982763

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: Ifaa7bf113ed85029d79cc0c09dc51cf277239306

commit_message:
[Swift] Bulk delete chunks from container

    * Add fallback to sequential delete of image chunks

Change-Id: I0d964bd9d743d14231098053ab93399801087827
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/78/793978/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def fake_post_account(headers, query_string, data): if query_string == 'bulk-delete': global SWIFT_POST_ACCOUNT_CALLS SWIFT_POST_ACCOUNT_CALLS += 1 return None, b'{}' def fake_delete_object(container, object_name): conn.post_account = fake_post_account global SWIFT_POST_ACCOUNT_CALLS SWIFT_POST_ACCOUNT_CALLS = 0 # Expecting 1 delete call for the bulk delete image segments # and 1 delete call for the manifest ACTUAL_DELETE_CALLS = \ SWIFT_DELETE_OBJECT_CALLS + SWIFT_POST_ACCOUNT_CALLS self.assertEqual(2, ACTUAL_DELETE_CALLS)
deleted_lines: def fake_delete_object(container, object_name): # Simulate error on 1st and 3rd segments if object_name.endswith('-001') or object_name.endswith('-003'): raise swiftclient.ClientException('Object DELETE failed') else: pass # Expecting 6 delete calls, 5 for the segments and 1 for the manifest self.assertEqual(6, SWIFT_DELETE_OBJECT_CALLS)

subject: Unparent PciDeviceSpec from PciAddressSpec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-02 14:55:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/96317eb8ec084d48c18d54e389d3f2ff1514a6aa', 'message': 'Unparent PciDeviceSpec from PciAddressSpec

It was never a good is-a relationship. The PciAddressSpec represents
either a PCI address or a set of addresses via wildcarding.
The PciDeviceSpec represents a complete PCI device so additionally to
the address, it has other information like vendor_id or other tags
provided in the [pci]device_spec configuration.

Also it was confusing as PciDeviceSpec contains a WhitelistPciAddress
which has an pci_address_spec field that is a true PciAddressSpec
instance.

To be able to break the connection the _set_pci_dev_info() login needed
to be moved out of PciAddressSpec. This is basically a hex string
validator and normalizer use for both PCI address fields and also for
vendor_id and product_id. So this is no moved to module level and
cleaned up.

PciAddressSpec has couple of valid children e.g. PciAddressRegexSpec.
Those are kept as is.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I07f8ac90ea2e269dd18d000b27dc0a10b27502c2
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-06-03 08:02:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/74fc171aff59e96df3c5ce28e30f1815b23d0711', 'message': 'Unparent PciDeviceSpec from PciAddressSpec

It was never a good is-a relationship. The PciAddressSpec represents
either a PCI address or a set of addresses via wildcarding.
The PciDeviceSpec represents a complete PCI device so additionally to
the address, it has other information like vendor_id or other tags
provided in the [pci]device_spec configuration.

Also it was confusing as PciDeviceSpec contains a WhitelistPciAddress
which has an pci_address_spec field that is a true PciAddressSpec
instance.

To be able to break the connection the _set_pci_dev_info() login needed
to be moved out of PciAddressSpec. This is basically a hex string
validator and normalizer use for both PCI address fields and also for
vendor_id and product_id. So this is no moved to module level and
cleaned up.

PciAddressSpec has couple of valid children e.g. PciAddressRegexSpec.
Those are kept as is.

commit_message:
Unparent PciDeviceSpec from PciAddressSpec

It was never a good is-a relationship. The PciAddressSpec represents
either a PCI address or a set of addresses via wildcarding.
The PciDeviceSpec represents a complete PCI device so additionally to
the address, it has other information like vendor_id or other tags
provided in the [pci]device_spec configuration.

Also it was confusing as PciDeviceSpec contains a WhitelistPciAddress
which has an pci_address_spec field that is a true PciAddressSpec
instance.

To be able to break the connection the _set_pci_dev_info() login needed
to be moved out of PciAddressSpec. This is basically a hex string
validator and normalizer use for both PCI address fields and also for
vendor_id and product_id. So this is no moved to module level and
cleaned up.

PciAddressSpec has couple of valid children e.g. PciAddressRegexSpec.
Those are kept as is.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I07f8ac90ea2e269dd18d000b27dc0a10b27502c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/844491/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param dev: A dictionary describing a single PCI device. It is in the format returned by the virt driver's get_available_resource() call in the pci_passthrough_devices key.
deleted_lines: :param dev: A dictionary describing the device properties

commit_message:
Add tests for secret consumers

This patch adds microversion support to the plugin.  It adds two new
configuration values in tempest.conf for selecting which tests to run.
See [1] for more details.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/microversion_testing.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/barbican/+/840712
Change-Id: Iba604f74fb645bec2f03fd4ffb771d8f051dccfe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin refs/changes/69/840969/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2022 Red Hat Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json from urllib import parse as urllib from tempest import config from barbican_tempest_plugin.services.key_manager.json import base CONF = config.CONF class SecretConsumerClient(base.BarbicanTempestClient): def list_consumers_in_secret(self, secret_id, **kwargs): uri = "/v1/secrets/%s/consumers" % secret_id if kwargs: uri += "?%s" % urllib.urlencode(kwargs) response, body = self.get(uri) self.expected_success(200, response.status) return json.loads(body.decode("utf-8")) def add_consumer_to_secret(self, secret_id, **kwargs): uri = "/v1/secrets/%s/consumers" % secret_id response, body = self.post(uri, json.dumps(kwargs)) self.expected_success(200, response.status) return json.loads(body.decode("utf-8")) def delete_consumer_from_secret(self, secret_id, **kwargs): uri = "/v1/secrets/%s/consumers" % secret_id response, body = self.delete(uri, body=json.dumps(kwargs)) self.expected_success(200, response.status) return json.loads(body.decode("utf-8"))

commit_message:
Fix bug when rolling back prov and op status for some API calls

POST l7rule API call and PUT pool API call had a bug that might have
kept a load balancer in provisioning_status when the call was rejected
by the provider.

The code didn't use the right locked DB session to set the statuses and
then to rollback them when an exception was caught.

Story 2010210
Task 45947

Change-Id: I494ea357afc072360765d7a30a9488e08bfda52c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/55/852455/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -- fixes: - | Fix load balancers stuck in PENDING_UPDATE issues for some API calls (POST /l7rule, PUT /pool) when a provider denied the call.

The relationship between PciAddressSpec and its childrens are pretty
messy. This patch makes sure that every children calls super().__init__
with proper parameters. This allows to remove unnecessary defaulting
from the parent class and also clarifies the parameter types a bit.

commit_message:
Fix PciAddressSpec descendants to call super.__init__

The relationship between PciAddressSpec and its childrens are pretty
messy. This patch makes sure that every children calls super().__init__
with proper parameters. This allows to remove unnecessary defaulting
from the parent class and also clarifies the parameter types a bit.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I6e94df5dbe56c51fd4704b50a6af53aa38f8453f

commit_message:
Changing filter pattern on setup module call

check-rsyslog validation demonstrated a novel syntax error
caused by form of the "filter" argument of the setup ansible module.

Modification of the argument form was made to align with module requirements.
The validation was added in catalogue tests.

Resolves: rhbz#2116304

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I15c56f71da5d7358e0a13d16bcd975d65b36c7b0

commit_message:
Enable post-copy by setting unprivileged_userfaultfd

The setting vm.unprivileged_userfaultfd = 1 is required to
make post-copy working for containerised libvirt.

Related: rhbz#2110556
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I40cf17a971e5c52e145fc7b760fd64c086284a03

commit_message:
Break out of import waiter on failure

If an image fails to import, it should go back to queued state. If
that happens, we should exit the waiter loop immediately so we can
examine the state. This is necessary for testing import failure
conditions.

Change-Id: I95fd142570e724e3dfd65def41b8b1f8fae2f8fe
Related-Blueprint: glance-download-import
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/06/852606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if image['status'] == 'queued': # If we revert back to queued, the import failed, so exit # immediately exc_cls = lib_exc.OtherRestClientException break

subject: Remove unused PF checking from get_function_by_ifname
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-14 15:21:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9cb578f2f5bd2c8c8999f7e3acc162722b84d19e', 'message': 'Remove unused PF checking from get_function_by_ifname

The nova.pci.utils.get_function_by_ifname function had a double purpose.
It translated the device name to PCI address and if that was
successful it also checked if the device is capable of supporting VFs.

For the latter we already have a separate function is_physical_function.

The only user of the PF checking was removed by a previous patch so this
patch drop the PF checking and renames the function to match the reduced
functionality.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I411d2187a6962f942c772440a20adbc2c6387f8c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-06-21 11:57:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f70adbb6138a03f7f8d1c3c285a97b71719cc254', 'message': 'Remove unused PF checking from get_function_by_ifname

The nova.pci.utils.get_function_by_ifname function had a double purpose.
It translated the device name to PCI address and if that was
successful it also checked if the device is capable of supporting VFs.

For the latter we already have a separate function is_physical_function.

The only user of the PF checking was removed by a previous patch so this
patch drop the PF checking and renames the function to match the reduced

commit_message:
Remove unused PF checking from get_function_by_ifname

The nova.pci.utils.get_function_by_ifname function had a double purpose.
It translated the device name to PCI address and if that was
successful it also checked if the device is capable of supporting VFs.

For the latter we already have a separate function is_physical_function.

The only user of the PF checking was removed by a previous patch so this
patch drop the PF checking and renames the function to match the reduced
functionality.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I411d2187a6962f942c772440a20adbc2c6387f8c

commit_message:
Update libvirt enlightenments for Windows

libvirt has a set of enlightenments in domain XML that make it
friendlier for Windows guests. We already enabled a few of these, this
patch just completes the list. All of them are available in libvirt
4.7.0 (QEMU 3.0) [1], which is way below our current minimum libvirt
and QEMU versions, so we don't need any extra checks.

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#hypervisor-features

Implements: bp/libvirt-update-windows-englightenments
Change-Id: I008841988547573878c4e06e82f0fa55084e51b5

commit_message:
Add 'swift_store_retry_put_count' for retrying chunk puts

This is useful when the network to swift is flakey, or swift
is flakey, or any of the above. It also matches the retrying
of gets so it adds a nice symmetry.

Change-Id: I875f0c45a3b47aa6ee1fbdba89d807a649ce6321
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/49/578549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sys cfg.IntOpt('swift_store_retry_put_count', default=0, min=0, help=_(""" The number of times a Swift chunk upload will be retried before the request fails. Provide an integer value representing the number of times an image chunk put must be retried before erroring out. The default value is zero (no retry on a failed chunk upload). When set to a positive integer value, ``swift_store_retry_put_count`` ensures that the upload is attempted this many more times upon a upload failure before sending an error message. Possible values: * Zero * Positive integer value Related Options: * None """)), retry_put_count = self.config.glance_store.swift_store_retry_put_count retry_put_count = max(1, retry_put_count + 1) # NOTE: this will happen at least once. last_exc_info = None for _i in range(0, retry_put_count): try: chunk_etag = \ manager.get_connection().put_object( location.container, chunk_name, reader, content_length=content_length) last_exc_info = None except Exception: last_exc_info = sys.exc_info() LOG.error( _("Error during chunked upload " "to backend.")) if last_exc_info is not None: six.reraise(*last_exc_info) else: written_chunks.append(chunk_name)
deleted_lines: chunk_etag = \ manager.get_connection().put_object( location.container, chunk_name, reader, content_length=content_length) written_chunks.append(chunk_name)

commit_message:
Fix chart builds

We broke the chart builds when we dropped the 'package' target in the
Makefile.   This fixes it also removes/drops the need to run the sed
locally since we point to the local folders anyways.

Change-Id: Iac8924f14c8fbb8e07b96b51790539c3ce1618e6

commit_message:
Add Skip ceph ingress option when ceph is deployed

This patch adds the new option that allows to skip the ceph ingress
daemon when ceph is deployed and more daemons are added to the cluster.

Depends-On: Ida1429f237ec9d85c007c757581ee57a49ac3808
Change-Id: I8e5542614e5d78f5ec4cea91e6a9952cd85a5ba3

commit_message:
Add more test coverage for devname base dev spec

Change-Id: I40888b8860e8cbf0025e21750bfd7240e692ed65
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/844625/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from unittest import mock dev_dict2 = { 'compute_node_id': 1, 'address': '0000:02:0a.1', 'product_id': '0001', 'vendor_id': '8086', 'status': 'available', 'phys_function': '0000:00:0a.0', } def test_devname_not_found(self): device_spec = '{"devname": "eth0"}' with mock.patch( 'nova.pci.utils.get_function_by_ifname', return_value=(None, False) ) as mock_pci_address_by_ifname: parsed = whitelist.Whitelist([device_spec]) self.assertEqual(1, len(parsed.specs)) self.assertFalse(parsed.device_assignable(dev_dict)) mock_pci_address_by_ifname.assert_has_calls( [ mock.call("eth0"), mock.call("eth0"), ] ) def test_devname_not_found_at_startup_but_found_at_match(self): device_spec = '{"devname": "eth0"}' with ( mock.patch( "nova.pci.utils.get_function_by_ifname", side_effect=[ (None, False), ("0000:00:0a.1", False), ("0000:00:0a.1", False), ], ) as mock_pci_address_by_ifname, mock.patch( "nova.pci.utils.is_physical_function", return_value=False ) as mock_is_phy_func, ): parsed = whitelist.Whitelist([device_spec]) self.assertEqual(1, len(parsed.specs)) self.assertTrue(parsed.device_assignable(dev_dict)) self.assertFalse(parsed.device_assignable(dev_dict2)) mock_pci_address_by_ifname.assert_has_calls( [ # whitelist __init__ mock.call("eth0"), # device_assignable #1 mock.call("eth0"), # device_assignable #2 mock.call("eth0"), ] ) mock_is_phy_func.assert_has_calls( [ # no call from __init__ as at that time devname was not found # device_assignable #1 mock.call('0000', '00', '0a', '1'), # device_assignable #2 mock.call('0000', '00', '0a', '1'), ] ) def test_devname_not_pf(self): device_spec = '{"devname": "eth0"}' with ( mock.patch( "nova.pci.utils.get_function_by_ifname", return_value=("0000:00:0a.1", False), ) as mock_pci_address_by_ifname, mock.patch( "nova.pci.utils.is_physical_function", return_value=False ) as mock_is_phy_func, ): parsed = whitelist.Whitelist([device_spec]) self.assertTrue(parsed.device_assignable(dev_dict)) self.assertFalse(parsed.device_assignable(dev_dict2)) mock_pci_address_by_ifname.assert_has_calls( [ # Whitelist init mock.call("eth0"), # device_assignable #1 mock.call("eth0"), # device_assignable #2 mock.call("eth0"), ] ) mock_is_phy_func.assert_has_calls( [ # whitelist __init__ after devname is translated mock.call('0000', '00', '0a', '1'), # device_assignable #1 mock.call('0000', '00', '0a', '1'), # device_assignable #2 mock.call('0000', '00', '0a', '1'), ] ) def test_devname_pf(self): device_spec = '{"devname": "eth0"}' with ( mock.patch( "nova.pci.utils.get_function_by_ifname", return_value=("0000:00:0a.1", True), ) as mock_pci_address_by_ifname, mock.patch( "nova.pci.utils.is_physical_function", return_value=True ) as mock_is_phy_func, ): parsed = whitelist.Whitelist([device_spec]) self.assertTrue(parsed.device_assignable(dev_dict)) self.assertFalse(parsed.device_assignable(dev_dict2)) mock_pci_address_by_ifname.assert_has_calls( [ # Whitelist init mock.call("eth0"), # device_assignable #1 mock.call("eth0"), # device_assignable #2 mock.call("eth0"), ] ) # Why it is not called for pf dev spec but called for non pf dev spec? mock_is_phy_func.assert_not_called()

commit_message:
Extra tests for remote managed dev spec

One added test shows that the remote managed precondition testing does
not work if the PCI address provided is wildcarded.

Anther test shows that if a PF is added the dev_spec then it is rejected
due to the wrong reason

Related-Bug: #1982763

Change-Id: Id7121a54ddb24b0fdc687172fd308a9d04517a94
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/844626/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_remote_managed_vf_by_pf_glob(self): """Same cases as test_remote_managed_vf_by_pf but the address in the device_spec config is glob. This test shows that the current remote managed codepath does not support globbed addresses. The same is true address with regex wildcarding. """ # Full match: 5058 is the expected VF product ID which # matches the one specified in the whitelist. This is to # simulate the supported matching of a VF by using its # product and vendor ID and a specific PF PCI address. pci_info = {"vendor_id": "8086", "address": "0000:*:00.0", "product_id": "5058", "physical_network": "hr_net", PCI_REMOTE_MANAGED_TAG: "true"} devspec.PciDeviceSpec(pci_info) # This spec would match both PFs and VFs. Since we care that # remote-managed PFs are not allowed, we have to prohibit the # this altogether. pci_info = {"vendor_id": "*", "address": "0000:*:00.0", "product_id": "*", "physical_network": "hr_net", PCI_REMOTE_MANAGED_TAG: "true"} # FIXME(gibi): This is silently accepted without checking the remote # managed pre conditions. I.e. no PF can be listed. devspec.PciDeviceSpec(pci_info) # Don't care about a VF product ID. Like above, this would # match both PFs and VFs (since VFs have the same vendor ID). # Therefore, this case is prohibited to avoid remote-managed PFs. pci_info = {"vendor_id": "8086", "address": "0000:*:00.0", "product_id": "*", "physical_network": "hr_net", PCI_REMOTE_MANAGED_TAG: "true"} # FIXME(gibi): This is silently accepted without checking the remote # managed pre conditions. I.e. no PF can be listed. devspec.PciDeviceSpec(pci_info) # Don't care about a VF vendor ID. pci_info = {"vendor_id": "*", "address": "0000:*:00.0", "product_id": "5058", "physical_network": "hr_net", PCI_REMOTE_MANAGED_TAG: "true"} devspec.PciDeviceSpec(pci_info) @mock.patch('nova.pci.utils.get_vf_product_id_by_pf_addr', new=mock.Mock(return_value="5058")) @mock.patch('nova.pci.utils.get_pci_ids_by_pci_addr', new=mock.Mock(return_value=("8086", "5057"))) @mock.patch('nova.pci.utils.is_physical_function', new=mock.Mock(return_value=True))

commit_message:
Update c9s job with new ssh key type

RSA ssh keys are now rejected by ssh client in c9s, generate a ECDSA key
for this job.

Change-Id: Ia8b90d74b657612a02bc2c30514f09f179ab97e3

added_lines: OCTAVIA_SSH_KEY_TYPE: edcsa

commit_message:
Add cell export to overcloud deploy

Run the equivalent of cell export after the stack is deployed.
The difference between overcloud export and cell export is that
should_filter=True when running cell export. As either of these exports
might be needed later to deploy other stacks, go ahead and make sure
both are always run.

Change-Id: Idceeb31609533b78034f0b25c4b0fbc6d47c19fb
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/53/851853/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _export_stack(self, parsed_args, should_filter, config_download_dir, export_file): # Create overcloud export data = export.export_overcloud( self.working_dir, parsed_args.stack, True, should_filter, config_download_dir) # write the exported data with open(export_file, 'w') as f: yaml.safe_dump(data, f, default_flow_style=False) os.chmod(export_file, 0o600) self._export_stack( parsed_args, False, config_download_dir, os.path.join( self.working_dir, "%s-export.yaml" % parsed_args.stack)) # Create overcloud cell export self._export_stack( parsed_args, True, config_download_dir, os.path.join( self.working_dir, "%s-cell-export.yaml" % parsed_args.stack))
deleted_lines: data = export.export_overcloud( self.working_dir, parsed_args.stack, True, False, config_download_dir) export_file = os.path.join( self.working_dir, "%s-export.yaml" % parsed_args.stack) # write the exported data with open(export_file, 'w') as f: yaml.safe_dump(data, f, default_flow_style=False) os.chmod(export_file, 0o600)

commit_message:
[DNM] Remove glance variable inside cinder

This should test if that glance var is still necessary.

I haven't found a record with grep that would justify the
presence. If it's for convenience for the user_*.yml, then
it totally can go away.

Change-Id: Ib0f17dbfebfe2ec17bedbb2a6d00cba32ba936c4

commit_message:
Add option websso_choices_hide_keystone

This change allows a cloud-deployer using WEBSSO to not expose a
form for attempting to log in using Keystone Credentials.

Closes-Bug: #1983855
Change-Id: Iae15a5dac8f3de0f70dad5af8837177f67857428
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/98/852398/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*websso_choices_hide_keystone*] # (optional)The WEBSSO_CHOICES option will by default include an entry for # "Keystone Credentials". Setting this option to true will hide it. # Default to false # $websso_choices_hide_keystone = false,

commit_message:
Increase ControlPersist timeout to 300 seconds

This ControlPersist socket periodically closing seems to be the
cause of intermittemt MODULE FAULIRE particularly in zuul CI
jobs. Extend the timout to make this less likley to happen.

See https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/78344

Change-Id: I54a9e637c9575c32429d28b89541ba026580e511
(cherry picked from commit cbdba67ad0b5a3e29db390c8e6b66721719184c0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/07/852107/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export ANSIBLE_SSH_ARGS="${ANSIBLE_SSH_ARGS:--C -o ControlMaster=auto -o ControlPersist=300}"

subject: Modify test code to avoid CONF modification affection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-05 10:49:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/b846cd34079df60ecaf06d91a440d1c3b2749851', 'message': 'Modify test code to avoid CONF modification affection

Few unit tests change attribute of  CONF variable via Python
assignment. This changes attribute of CONF, which is instance
of XxxOpt class defined in oslo_config, to Python literal value.
This affects result of another unit test.

To avoid this, we should change attribute of CONF variable with
set_override method.

Change-Id: I4bd8b1b4ea974834f1149fcaa79de85d24f5f7d1
Story: 2010214
Task: 45956
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-08-07 05:16:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/b1c593d159e32f2b41edfdc90e799496b1b4926d', 'message': 'Modify test code to avoid CONF modification affection

Few unit tests change attribute of  CONF variable via Python
assignment. This changes attribute of CONF, which is instance
of XxxOpt class defined in oslo_config, to Python literal value.

This affects result of another unit test.

To avoid this, we should change attribute of CONF variable with
set_override method.

Change-Id: I4bd8b1b4ea974834f1149fcaa79de85d24f5f7d1
Story: 2010214

commit_message:
Modify test code to avoid CONF modification affection

Few unit tests change attribute of  CONF variable via Python
assignment. This changes attribute of CONF, which is instance
of XxxOpt class defined in oslo_config, to Python literal value.

This affects result of another unit test.

To avoid this, we should change attribute of CONF variable with
set_override method.

Change-Id: I4bd8b1b4ea974834f1149fcaa79de85d24f5f7d1
Story: 2010214
Task: 45956
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/852253

commit_message:
Update raid_type handling for Redfish raid_config

Fix indentation for case when raid_type is missing.
Generally, it is not expected that raid_type will be
missing, this is done as a precaution as raid_type
was introduced in Redfish 1.3.1. Now log warning
that raid_type is missing, thus cannot update
raid_config correctly.

Followup to I753c4b00c0a64bcdc89c9bc0afd46f1211f7847b

Change-Id: Id66b87309dd26a2a165b35ac1d81580e4605d629

commit_message:
Also install docker collection for CI reproducer

For those who still use docker compose for CI reproducer,
resovle that missing dependency collection.

there is no strict dependency to install these

commit_message:
SF: Remove compat clone image code

SolidFire driver introduced a clone image feature in Kilo release[1]
where we would create a cache volume with volume ID same as of image
ID to create volume from image efficiently by cloning from that cached
volume.
This feature worked same as the image cache feature we have in cinder
so it was deprecated in queens[2] and removed in train[3] in favor of
image cache feature provided by cinder.
However, we still kept compatibility code if users had solidfire cached
volumes to still take advantage of those to create efficient volume
from images.
In the current master (Yoga), we can safely assume that people have
moved to using the image cache feature of cinder since the solidfire
options to enable efficient cloning doesn't exist since train release.
This patch removes the remaining code around this feature as it
doesn't provide any additional benefit and we also log an ERROR
message unnecessarily confusing the operators for every create volume
from image request (details are in the linked launchpad bug).

Closes-Bug: #1959178

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/142859
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/511623
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/664739

Change-Id: I8fe00b06ebb439f83f8cad0f592064c540c54b77
(cherry picked from commit 6b97abc4e4f364e95e09b1738798fa2b6ebd90d6)
(cherry picked from commit 9b583401adfd63d3d311bb9515f9a27b9b679a6f)

Users are notified of the situation via the release note.

commit_message:
Restart tuned service to apply tuned boot options

During baremetal node provisioning, the tuned role enabled for
NFV usescase does not set the $tuned_params to kernelargs properly.
Restarting tuned service, so that the tuned cmdline options gets
set from /boot/loader/entires on node reboot

Change-Id: Iec2195edd4f5ab35c44f173ef51267c60aa2f0d2

commit_message:
Get rid of warning caused by [service_credentials] region_name

oslo.config automatically replaces - in option names by _. Because of
this behavior now we get the following warning always if
the [service_credentials] region_name parameter is set.

Deprecated: Option "region_name" from group "service_credentials" is
deprecated. Use option "region_name" from group "service_credentials".

Change-Id: I2a8d09aaef4621d3f99d1d7025db9b357c44398e
